back_cards.example_en: I need water after the run.

back_cards.definition_en: To have a necessity or obligation.
back_cards.example_en: You need to finish your homework.

back_cards.definition_en: To lack or be short of something.
back_cards.example_en: We need more chairs for guests.
I need you to call me now.

back_cards.definition_en: To desire strongly for a purpose.
back_cards.example_en: She needs a break from work.

back_cards.definition_en: To or toward a previous place.
back_cards.example_en: I’m going back to the store.
The back of the house is quiet.

back_cards.definition_en: To return to an earlier time.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s go back to last summer.
I’ve got your back, don’t worry.
You should study for the test.
We should try that new café.
She should be here by now.
If I win, I should celebrate.
Even I can’t solve this puzzle.
She didn’t even call me back.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to introduce a further point.
Refers to a single thing or person.
back_cards.example_en: I have only one ticket left.
Only you can make this choice.
I meant only to help you.

back_cards.definition_en: A large number of things or people.

back_cards.example_en: I have many books to read.
There are many ways to solve this.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to express surprise or disbelief.
back_cards.example_en: Did you really climb that mountain?
I’m really sorry for being late.

back_cards.definition_en: To perform a task or effort.
back_cards.example_en: She works on her project daily.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a place of employment.
The existence of a living being.

back_cards.example_en: This party has so much life!

back_cards.definition_en: Asks for the reason or cause.

back_cards.example_en: I don’t know why she left.
Why does the sky look orange?

back_cards.definition_en: Toward a lower position or level.
back_cards.example_en: The ball rolled down the hill.

back_cards.definition_en: To attempt or make an effort.
back_cards.example_en: I’ll try to fix the sink.
This puzzle will try your patience.
Let me help you with that.
Don’t let the dog run free.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to refer to an unknown object.

back_cards.example_en: I’m going to the party too.
It’s too late to call now.
She’s way too smart for that.
The woman helped me find my way.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to express a wish or hope.
back_cards.example_en: May you have a great day.

back_cards.definition_en: Used in formal or polite contexts.

back_cards.example_en: It’s late, but I’m still working.

back_cards.definition_en: Moving from one side to another.
By means of or because of.
back_cards.example_en: I heard it through a friend.
Go through the door to exit.
What did you mean by that?
I didn’t mean to upset you.
Don’t be mean to your sister.
Dark clouds mean rain is coming.
She was after me in line.
I was tired after the hike.
The world is a big place.
She’s famous in the art world.
The world loves a good story.
It means the world to me.
I feel the wind on my face.
I feel this is a bad idea.
Feel how soft this blanket is.
She feels sick after the ride.

back_cards.definition_en: Used as a filler in conversation.
back_cards.example_en: So, yeah, I was at the park.

back_cards.definition_en: Final in a series or sequence.
back_cards.example_en: This is the last piece of cake.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to the end of something.
back_cards.example_en: It’s the last day of school.
The child played in the park.

back_cards.definition_en: A person in a specific context.

back_cards.example_en: The plane flew over the city.
Put a blanket over the couch.
Can you ask her to call me?
They asked us to the party.
I asked where the store was.
This job asks a lot of you.
The kids are at school now.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of learners or faculty.

back_cards.example_en: She’s from the school of art.
I live in the state of Texas.
She’s in a happy state today.
The state passed a new law.
I don’t have much time left.
We were just talking about you.
I’ll talk him into joining us.
I keep snacks in the drawer.

back_cards.definition_en: To take care of or protect.

back_cards.example_en: Keep the rules of the game.
Leave the dishes in the sink.
Put the keys on the table.

back_cards.definition_en: To cause to be in a state.
back_cards.example_en: You put me in a tough spot.
They put him on the night shift.
I put effort into this project.
Can you help me with this box?
I can’t help laughing at that.
She helped herself to some cake.
That movie was a big hit.
She has big dreams for the future.
That’s where I parked my car.
I’m at a point where I need help.
Where did you find that book?
They look the same to me.
That’s the same price as yesterday.
I made it on my own.
He lives on his own now.
I read while waiting for you.
She likes tea, while I prefer coffee.
While it’s expensive, it’s worth it.
The loud noise made me start.
I have three cats at home.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a trio or group.

back_cards.example_en: I’ll be there in three minutes.
Three books are on the table.
I’m on a high after winning.
This is a high priority task.
I’ll have another slice of pizza.
What became of your old phone?
This is the most fun I’ve had.
Most of the cake is gone.
I’m most grateful for your help.

back_cards.definition_en: In the space separating two things.

back_cards.example_en: I can’t tell between the twins.
I happened to meet her there.
If you’re late, trouble will happen.
It happens that I’m free today.
Cats belong to the feline family.
Our team is like a family.
She comes from a big family.
She’s the president of the club.

back_cards.definition_en: A title for a high official.
Having lived for a long time.

back_cards.example_en: Yes, I’ll come to the party.
Yes, go ahead and try it.
Yes, I see what you mean.
Our house has a big yard.
She showed me her new phone.
Can you show me the way?

back_cards.definition_en: To a previous place or condition.
A learner in a specific field.
Refers to a group of learners.
To appear or give the impression.

back_cards.example_en: He seems to know the answer.
It seems I forgot my keys.
I might go if I’m free.
He pushed with all his might.
I ate part of the cake.
She played a part in the plan.
We parted ways at the corner.
He had no part in it.
I hear music from the room.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to something belonging to it.

back_cards.example_en: The car has its own GPS.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a place or thing.

back_cards.example_en: This is a nice place to relax.
Place the cup on the table.
She took her place as leader.
Save me a place at the show.
I’m in a tough place now.
We have a problem with the car.
Littering is a big problem here.
Her injury is a problem for the team.
I believe it’s going to rain.
We live out in the country.
My country has a rich history.
I work five days a week.

back_cards.definition_en: A unit in scoring or measuring.
The part of the body at the end of the arm.
back_cards.example_en: She held the cup in her hand.
Can you give me a hand?
He had a hand in the project.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a worker or player.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a great hand at cards.

back_cards.definition_en: Away from a place or position.
To engage in a game or sport.
back_cards.example_en: The kids play soccer after school.

back_cards.definition_en: To perform music or a role.
To act in a casual way.
To have a role or effect.
back_cards.example_en: Luck played a part in it.
Turn the knob to open it.
Let’s turn to the next topic.
I have a few cookies left.

back_cards.definition_en: A collection of people or things.

back_cards.example_en: Let’s group the items by color.
This group of plants needs sun.

back_cards.definition_en: Of a particular kind or type.
back_cards.example_en: I’ve never seen such a view.
It was such a fun party.
Things like pens, such as these.
The ladder is against the wall.
Her red dress stood out against the snow.

back_cards.definition_en: An informal term for a man.
back_cards.example_en: That guy helped me fix my tire.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a person in general.

back_cards.example_en: He’s a funny guy to know.
The guy in the hat is my friend.
This is a case of bad luck.
In that case, I’ll stay home.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a set of facts.

back_cards.example_en: I have a question about homework.
The question is how to fix it.

back_cards.definition_en: The time between evening and morning.
Refers to darkness or late hours.

back_cards.example_en: It’s game night at our house.
The concert was live on TV.
They live on a tight budget.

back_cards.definition_en: A form of play or amusement.

back_cards.example_en: She’s got a good game plan.
They hunt game in the forest.
The number of guests is ten.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a group or amount.
To compose or set down on paper.

back_cards.example_en: She writes poetry in her spare time.
He wrote me a quick email.
Bring your coat to the party.
Her speech brought tears to my eyes.

back_cards.definition_en: To lead to or result in.

back_cards.example_en: He brought up a good point.
The kids played without the fence.
He went hiking without a map.
Save money for a rainy day.
I have a lot of homework.
They built on an empty lot.
This lot of apples is fresh.
It’s my lot in life to try.
Thanks a lot for your help.
This book taught me a lot.
We need a new system here.

back_cards.definition_en: The ruling authority of a country.
back_cards.example_en: The government passed a new law.
Democracy is our form of government.
I live in the next house.
